docs.snippet: Maybe a half-million people a day watched the Olympics on live streams — an object lesson for NBC....
docs.lead_paragraph: Maybe a half-million people a day watched the Olympics on live streams — an object lesson for NBC.

headline.main: How Streaming Is Changing Sports Watching

docs.snippet: Had the United States women competed as a separate country, they would have been third in the overall medal chart with 61....
docs.lead_paragraph: Had the United States women competed as a separate country, they would have been third in the overall medal chart with 61.
docs.abstract: Jere Longman On Olympics column remarks not only on standout performance by American athletes at Rio Olympics, but also on dominance displayed by American women; traces outstanding performance by women to introduction of Title IX in 1972 and passage of Amateur Sports Act in 1978.

headline.main: For Those Keeping Score, American Women Dominated in Rio
headline.print_headline: In Top Effort by U.S., American Women Are Pre-eminent

docs.snippet: The next three Games are in East Asia, half a day away on the clock. That makes for scheduling headaches even as audiences fragment....
docs.lead_paragraph: The next three Games are in East Asia, half a day away on the clock. That makes for scheduling headaches even as audiences fragment.
docs.abstract: Television analysts anticipate NBCUniversal will alter its Olympics model following lower-than-expected viewership of Rio Games; say network, which has billions of dollars invested in three future Asia-based games, faces declining television audiences and 13- to 14-hour time difference.

headline.main: With Audience Shrinking, NBC Looks Cautiously to Olympics in Asia
headline.print_headline: With Audience Shrinking, NBC Looks Cautiously to Olympics in Asia

docs.snippet: Real estate and entertainment conglomerate Dalian Wanda Group Co expects to seal two billion-dollar film-related deals in the United States this year, chairman Wang Jianlin said on Tuesday, as China's richest man steps up his push into Hollywood....
docs.lead_paragraph: Real estate and entertainment conglomerate Dalian Wanda Group Co expects to seal two billion-dollar film-related deals in the United States this year, chairman Wang Jianlin said on Tuesday, as China's richest man steps up his push into Hollywood.

headline.main: Exclusive: China's Richest Man Set to Seal Two Billion-Dollar U.S. Film Deals
headline.print_headline: Exclusive: China's Richest Man Set to Seal Two Billion-Dollar U.S. Film Deals

docs.snippet: As editor in chief of Emerge, Mr. Curry shifted the emphasis from entertainment to news and came up with a motto: “Black America’s Newsmagazine.”...
docs.lead_paragraph: As editor in chief of Emerge, Mr. Curry shifted the emphasis from entertainment to news and came up with a motto: “Black America’s Newsmagazine.”
docs.abstract: George E Curry, writer and editor whose work in newspapers and magazines often addressed social issues faced by black Americans, dies at age 69.

headline.main: George Curry, Journalist With a Mission to Serve Black Readers, Dies at 69
headline.print_headline: George Curry, 69; A Pioneer of Print Media

docs.snippet: During an hour-long chat at his Los Angeles home, Henry Winkler does impressions of George Foreman, Terry Bradshaw and William Shatner (his co-stars in the new NBC reality series "Better Late Than Never"), walks like a ninja who suddenly sports ja...
docs.lead_paragraph: During an hour-long chat at his Los Angeles home, Henry Winkler does impressions of George Foreman, Terry Bradshaw and William Shatner (his co-stars in the new NBC reality series "Better Late Than Never"), walks like a ninja who suddenly sports jazz hands, and improvises a scene as the intolerant acting coach he plays in a new HBO comedy.

headline.main: Henry Winkler Bonds With Icons in New Show, Dreams of Tony
headline.print_headline: Henry Winkler Bonds With Icons in New Show, Dreams of Tony
